channel.title: I've done everything to get my server online (Still not working!)
channel.description:
So heres the deal, i portfowarded, got no-ip and No-ip DUC running checked the smiley face (he's blushing) allowed an exception in my port. I have JDK and everything,[b] only people under my internet connection can connect 2 my server using my computers ip [/b] Everyone thats not under my internet connection say they get errors when trying to connect using my No-ip, computers ip, and even my internet ip. None of it works for them. How do i allow people that arent under my internet connection to connect to my server??
Portfowarding
[IMG]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Camoboii/Portfoward-1.jpg[/img]
Virtual Server (looked like an advanced portfoward so i filled it out as well, maybe i have to have both ports enabled instead of just TCP??)
[IMG]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Camoboii/VirtualServer-1.jpg[/img]
My No-ip DUC
[IMG]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Camoboii/No-ipDUC.jpg[/img]
Network (decided to use Local Area Connection)
[IMG]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Camoboii/Networkselections.jpg[/img]
Thing on my computer named Internet Connection Sharing (ICS) i wondered if you guys think i should check mark this
[IMG]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Camoboii/ICSServer.jpg[/img]

item.title: I've done everything to get my server online (Still not working!)
item.dc:creator: @Xx_R_A_G_3_R Xx R A G 3 R
item.description:
@Xx_R_A_G_3_R wrote:

I’ve only added 1 port in the Firewall exceptions

EDIT: I’ve just added a UDP port of 43594 in exceptions tab.

EDIT: Still not working!

Read full topic
